Name: Detect Anomalies and Events - Baseline of Events
Description: Anomalous activity shall be detected and the potential impact of events is understood. A baseline of network operations and expected data flows for users and systems shall be  established and managed

Name: Detect Anomalies and Events - Analyze Events
Description: Anomalous activity shall be detected and the potential impact of events is understood. Detected events shall be analyzed to understand attack targets and methods

Name: Detect Anomalies and Events - Event Correlation
Description: Anomalous activity shall be detected and the potential impact of events is understood. Event data shall be collected and correlated from multiple sources and sensors

Name: Detect Anomalies and Events - Event Impact
Description: Anomalous activity shall be detected and the potential impact of events is understood. Impact of events shall be determined

Name: Detect Anomalies and Events - Alert Thresholds
Description: Anomalous activity shall be detected and the potential impact of events is understood. Incident alert thresholds shall be established

Name: Detect Continuous Monitoring - Monitor Network
Description: The information system and assets shall be monitored to identify cybersecurity events and verify the effectiveness of protective measures. The network shall be monitored to detect potential cybersecurity events

Name: Detect Continuous Monitoring - Physical Environment Monitoring
Description: The information system and assets shall be monitored to identify cybersecurity events and verify the effectiveness of protective measures. The physical environment shall be monitored to detect potential cybersecurity events

Name: Detect Continuous Monitoring - Personnel Activity Monitoring
Description: The information system and assets shall be monitored to identify cybersecurity events and verify the effectiveness of protective measures. Personnel activity shall be monitored to detect potential cybersecurity events

Name: Detect Continuous Monitoring - Detect Malicious Code
Description: The information system and assets shall be monitored to identify cybersecurity events and verify the effectiveness of protective measures. Malicious code shall be detected

Name: Detect Continuous Monitoring - Detect Unauthorized Mobile Code
Description: The information system and assets shall be monitored to identify cybersecurity events and verify the effectiveness of protective measures. Unauthorized mobile code shall be  detected

Name: Detect Continuous Monitoring - Monitor External Service Providers
Description: The information system and assets shall be monitored to identify cybersecurity events and verify the effectiveness of protective measures. External service provider activity shall be monitored to detect potential cybersecurity events

Name: Detect Continuous Monitoring - Monitor for Unauthorized
Description: The information system and assets shall be monitored to identify cybersecurity events and verify the effectiveness of protective measures. Monitoring for unauthorized personnel, connections, devices, and software shall be performed

Name: Detect Continuous Monitoring - Vulnerability Scans
Description: The information system and assets shall be monitored to identify cybersecurity events and verify the effectiveness of protective measures. Vulnerability scans shall be performed

Name: Detect Processes - Detection Roles and Responsibilities
Description: Detection processes and procedures shall be maintained and tested to ensure awareness of anomalous events. Roles and responsibilities for detection shall be well defined to ensure accountability

Name: Detect Processes - Detection Compliance
Description: Detection processes and procedures shall be maintained and tested to ensure awareness of anomalous events. Detection activities shall comply with all applicable requirements

Name: Detect Processes - Detection Testing
Description: Detection processes and procedures shall be maintained and tested to ensure awareness of anomalous events. Detection processes shall be tested

Name: Detect Processes - Detection Information Communicated
Description: Detection processes and procedures shall be maintained and tested to ensure awareness of anomalous events. Event detection information shall be communicated

Name: Detect Processes - Continuous Improvement
Description: Detection processes and procedures shall be maintained and tested to ensure awareness of anomalous events. Detection processes shall be continuously improved.

Name: Identify Asset Management - Physical Asset Inventory
Description: The data, personnel, devices, systems, and facilities that enable the organization to achieve business purposes shall be identified and managed consistent with their relative importance to organizational objectives and the organizations risk strategy. Physical devices and systems within the organization shall be inventoried

Name: Identify Asset Management - Software Inventory
Description: The data, personnel, devices, systems, and facilities that enable the organization to achieve business purposes shall be identified and managed consistent with their relative importance to organizational objectives and the organizations risk strategy. Software platforms and applications within the organization shall be inventoried

Name: Identify Asset Management - Data Flow Mapping
Description: The data, personnel, devices, systems, and facilities that enable the organization to achieve business purposes shall be identified and managed consistent with their relative importance to organizational objectives and the organizations risk strategy. Organizational communication and data flows shall be mapped

Name: Identify Asset Management - External Systems Catalogued
Description: The data, personnel, devices, systems, and facilities that enable the organization to achieve business purposes shall be identified and managed consistent with their relative importance to organizational objectives and the organizations risk strategy. External information systems shall be catalogued

Name: Identify Asset Management - Resource Prioritization
Description: The data, personnel, devices, systems, and facilities that enable the organization to achieve business purposes shall be identified and managed consistent with their relative importance to organizational objectives and the organizations risk strategy. Resources (e.g., hardware, devices, data, time, personnel, and software) shall be prioritized based on their classification, criticality, and business value

Name: Identify Asset Management - Roles and Responsibilities
Description: The data, personnel, devices, systems, and facilities that enable the organization to achieve business purposes shall be identified and managed consistent with their relative importance to organizational objectives and the organizations risk strategy. Cybersecurity roles and responsibilities for the entire workforce and third-party stakeholders (e.g., suppliers, customers, partners) shall be established

Name: Identify Business Environment - Supply Chain Role
Description: The organizations mission, objectives, stakeholders, and activities shall be understood and prioritized. This information shall be used to inform cybersecurity roles, responsibilities, and risk management decisions. The organizations role in the supply chain shall be identified and communicated

Name: Identify Business Environment - Critical Infrastructure Role
Description: The organizations mission, objectives, stakeholders, and activities shall be understood and prioritized. This information shall be used to inform cybersecurity roles, responsibilities, and risk management decisions. The organizations place in critical infrastructure and its industry sector shall be identified and communicated

Name: Identify Business Environment - Missions and Objectives
Description: The organizations mission, objectives, stakeholders, and activities shall be understood and prioritized. This information shall be used to inform cybersecurity roles, responsibilities, and risk management decisions. Priorities for organizational mission, objectives, and activities shall be established and communicated

Name: Identify Business Environment - Dependencies Established
Description: The organizations mission, objectives, stakeholders, and activities shall be understood and prioritized. This information shall be used to inform cybersecurity roles, responsibilities, and risk management decisions. Dependencies and critical functions for delivery of critical services shall be established

Name: Identify Business Environment - Resilience Requirements
Description: The organizations mission, objectives, stakeholders, and activities shall be understood and prioritized. This information shall be used to inform cybersecurity roles, responsibilities, and risk management decisions. Resilience requirements to support delivery of critical services shall be established for all operating states (e.g. under duress/attack, during recovery, normal operations)

Name: Identify Governance - Information Security Policy
Description: The policies, procedures, and processes to manage and monitor the organizations regulatory, legal, risk, environmental, and operational requirements shall be understood and inform the management of cybersecurity risk. Organizational cybersecurity policy shall be established and communicated

Name: Identify Governance - Information Security Roles and Responsibilities
Description: The policies, procedures, and processes to manage and monitor the organizations regulatory, legal, risk, environmental, and operational requirements shall be understood and inform the management of cybersecurity risk. Cybersecurity roles and responsibilities shall be coordinated and aligned with internal roles and external partners

Name: Identify Governance - Legal and Regulatory Requirements
Description: The policies, procedures, and processes to manage and monitor the organizations regulatory, legal, risk, environmental, and operational requirements shall be understood and inform the management of cybersecurity risk. Legal and regulatory requirements regarding cybersecurity, including privacy and civil liberties obligations, shall be understood and managed

Name: Identify Governance - Governance Addresses Risks
Description: The policies, procedures, and processes to manage and monitor the organizations regulatory, legal, risk, environmental, and operational requirements shall be understood and inform the management of cybersecurity risk. Governance and risk management processes shall address cybersecurity risks

Name: Identify Risk Assessment - Identify Vulnerabilities
Description: The organization shall understand the cybersecurity risk to organizational operations (including mission, functions, image, or reputation), organizational assets, and individuals. Asset vulnerabilities shall be identified and documented

Name: Identify Risk Assessment - Information Sharing Sources
Description: The organization shall understand the cybersecurity risk to organizational operations (including mission, functions, image, or reputation), organizational assets, and individuals. Cyber threat intelligence shall be received from information sharing forums and sources

Name: Identify Risk Assessment - Identify Threats
Description: The organization shall understand the cybersecurity risk to organizational operations (including mission, functions, image, or reputation), organizational assets, and individuals. Threats, both internal and external, shall be identified and documented

Name: Identify Risk Assessment - Identify Business Impact
Description: The organization shall understand the cybersecurity risk to organizational operations (including mission, functions, image, or reputation), organizational assets, and individuals. Potential business impacts and likelihoods shall be identified

Name: Identify Risk Assessment - Threats Determine Risk
Description: The organization shall understand the cybersecurity risk to organizational operations (including mission, functions, image, or reputation), organizational assets, and individuals. Threats, vulnerabilities, likelihoods, and impacts shall be used to determine risk

Name: Identify Risk Assessment - Risk Response
Description: The organization shall understand the cybersecurity risk to organizational operations (including mission, functions, image, or reputation), organizational assets, and individuals. Risk responses shall be identified and prioritized

Name: Identify Risk Management - Risk Management Processes
Description: The organizations priorities, constraints, risk tolerances, and assumptions shall be established and used to support operational risk decisions. Risk management processes shall be  established, managed, and agreed to by organizational stakeholders

Name: Identify Risk Management - Risk Tolerance
Description: The organizations priorities, constraints, risk tolerances, and assumptions shall be established and used to support operational risk decisions. Organizational risk tolerance shall be determined and clearly expressed

Name: Identify Risk Management - Role in Critical Infrastructure
Description: The organizations priorities, constraints, risk tolerances, and assumptions shall be established and used to support operational risk decisions. The organizations determination of risk tolerance shall be informed by its role in critical infrastructure and sector specific risk analysis

Name: Supply Chain Risk Management - Manage Processes
Description: The organizations priorities, constraints, risk tolerances, and assumptions shall be established and used to support risk decisions associated with managing supply chain risk. The organization shall establish and implement the processes to identify, assess and manage supply chain risks. Cyber supply chain risk management processes shall be identified, established, assessed, managed, and agreed to by organizational stakeholders

Name: Supply Chain Risk Management - Suppliers & Third Parties
Description: The organizations priorities, constraints, risk tolerances, and assumptions shall be established and used to support risk decisions associated with managing supply chain risk. The organization shall establish and implement the processes to identify, assess and manage supply chain risks. Suppliers and third party partners of information systems, components, and services shall be identified, prioritized, and assessed using a cyber supply chain risk assessment process

Name: Supply Chain Risk Management - Contracts
Description: The organizations priorities, constraints, risk tolerances, and assumptions shall be established and used to support risk decisions associated with managing supply chain risk. The organization shall establish and implement the processes to identify, assess and manage supply chain risks. Contracts with suppliers and third-party partners shall be used to implement appropriate measures designed to meet the objectives of an organizations cybersecurity program and Cyber Supply Chain Risk Management Plan.

Name: Supply Chain Risk Management - Assessment
Description: The organizations priorities, constraints, risk tolerances, and assumptions shall be established and used to support risk decisions associated with managing supply chain risk. The organization shall establish and implement the processes to identify, assess and manage supply chain risks. Suppliers and third-party partners shall be routinely assessed using audits, test results, or other forms of evaluations to confirm they are meeting their contractual obligations.

Name: Supply Chain Risk Management - Response & Recovery
Description: The organizations priorities, constraints, risk tolerances, and assumptions shall be established and used to support risk decisions associated with managing supply chain risk. The organization shall establish and implement the processes to identify, assess and manage supply chain risks. Response and recovery planning and testing shall be conducted with suppliers and third-party providers

Name: Protect Asset Control - Manage Identities
Description: Access to physical and logical assets and associated facilities shall be limited to authorized users, processes, and devices, and is managed consistent with the assessed risk of unauthorized access to authorized activities and transactions. Identities and credentials shall be issued, managed, verified, revoked, and audited for authorized devices, users and processes

Name: Protect Asset Control - Manage Physical Access
Description: Access to physical and logical assets and associated facilities shall be limited to authorized users, processes, and devices, and shall be managed consistent with the assessed risk of unauthorized access to authorized activities and transactions. Physical access to assets shall be managed and protected

Name: Protect Asset Control - Manage Remote Access
Description: Access to physical and logical assets and associated facilities shall be limited to authorized users, processes, and devices, and is managed consistent with the assessed risk of unauthorized access to authorized activities and transactions. Remote access shall be managed

Name: Protect Asset Control - Principles of Least Privilege
Description: Access to physical and logical assets and associated facilities shall be limited to authorized users, processes, and devices, and is managed consistent with the assessed risk of unauthorized access to authorized activities and transactions. Access permissions and authorizations shall be managed, incorporating the principles of least privilege and separation of duties

Name: Protect Asset Control - Network Segragation
Description: Access to physical and logical assets and associated facilities shall be limited to authorized users, processes, and devices, and is managed consistent with the assessed risk of unauthorized access to authorized activities and transactions. Network integrity shall be protected (e.g., network segregation, network segmentation)

Name: Protect Asset Control - Identity Assertion
Description: Access to physical and logical assets and associated facilities shall be limited to authorized users, processes, and devices, and is managed consistent with the assessed risk of unauthorized access to authorized activities and transactions. Identities shall be proofed and bound to credentials and asserted in interactions

Name: Protect Asset Control - Risk Based Authentication
Description: Access to physical and logical assets and associated facilities shall be limited to authorized users, processes, and devices, and is managed consistent with the assessed risk of unauthorized access to authorized activities and transactions. Users, devices, and other assets shall be authenticated (e.g., single-factor, multi-factor) commensurate with the risk of the transaction (e.g., individuals security and privacy risks and other organizational risks)

Name: Protect Awareness and Training - Users Informed and Trained
Description: The organizations personnel and partners shall be provided cybersecurity awareness education and are trained to perform their cybersecurity-related duties and responsibilities consistent with related policies, procedures, and agreements. All users shall be informed and trained

Name: Protect Awareness and Training - Understand Roles and Responsibilities
Description: The organizations personnel and partners shall be provided cybersecurity awareness education and shall be trained to perform their cybersecurity-related duties and responsibilities consistent with related policies, procedures, and agreements. Privileged users shall understand their roles and responsibilities

Name: Protect Awareness and Training - Third Party Roles and Responsibilities
Description: The organizations personnel and partners shall be provided cybersecurity awareness education and are trained to perform their cybersecurity-related duties and responsibilities consistent with related policies, procedures, and agreements. Third-party stakeholders (e.g., suppliers, customers, partners) shall understand their roles and responsibilities

Name: Protect Awareness and Training - Execs Roles and Responsibilities
Description: The organizations personnel and partners shall be provided cybersecurity awareness education and are trained to perform their cybersecurity-related duties and responsibilities consistent with related policies, procedures, and agreements. Senior executives shall understand their roles and responsibilities

Name: Protect Awareness and Training - Infosec Roles and Responsibilities
Description: The organizations personnel and partners shall be provided cybersecurity awareness education ands hall be trained to perform their cybersecurity-related duties and responsibilities consistent with related policies, procedures, and agreements. Physical and cybersecurity personnel shall understand their roles and responsibilities

Name: Protect Data Security - Data at Rest
Description: Information and records (data) shall be managed consistent with the organizations risk strategy to protect the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of information. Data-at-rest shall be protected

Name: Protect Data Security - Data in Transit
Description: Information and records (data) shall be managed consistent with the organizations risk strategy to protect the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of information. Data-in-transit shall be protected

Name: Protect Data Security - Manage Assets Formally
Description: Information and records (data) shall be managed consistent with the organizations risk strategy to protect the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of information. Assets shall be formally managed throughout removal, transfers, and disposition

Name: Protect Data Security - Ensure Availability
Description: Information and records (data) shall be managed consistent with the organizations risk strategy to protect the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of information. Adequate capacity to ensure availability shall be maintained

Name: Protect Data Security - Data Leak Protection
Description: Information and records (data) shall be managed consistent with the organizations risk strategy to protect the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of information. Protections against data leaks shall be implemented

Name: Protect Data Security - Integrity Checking
Description: Information and records (data) shall be managed consistent with the organizations risk strategy to protect the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of information. Integrity checking mechanisms shall be used to verify software, firmware, and information integrity

Name: Protect Data Security - Separate Dev and Production Environments
Description: Information and records (data) shall be managed consistent with the organizations risk strategy to protect the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of information. The development and testing environment(s) shall be separate from the production environment

Name: Protect Data Security - Hardware Integrity Checking
Description: "Information and records (data) shall be managed consistent with the organization's risk strategy to protect the confidentiality
column6: and availability of information. Integrity checking mechanisms shall be used to verify hardware integrity"

Name: Protect Process and Procedures - Baseline Configuration
Description: Security policies (that address purpose, scope, roles, responsibilities, management commitment, and coordination among organizational entities), processes, and procedures shall be maintained and used to manage protection of information systems and assets. A baseline configuration of information technology/industrial control systems shall be created and maintained incorporating security principles (e.g. concept of least functionality)

Name: Protect Process and Procedures - SDLC
Description: Security policies (that address purpose, scope, roles, responsibilities, management commitment, and coordination among organizational entities), processes, and procedures shall be maintained and used to manage protection of information systems and assets. A System Development Life Cycle to manage systems shall be implemented

Name: Protect Process and Procedures - Change Control
Description: Security policies (that address purpose, scope, roles, responsibilities, management commitment, and coordination among organizational entities), processes, and procedures shall be maintained and used to manage protection of information systems and assets. Configuration change control processes shall be in place

Name: Protect Process and Procedures - Backups
Description: Security policies (that address purpose, scope, roles, responsibilities, management commitment, and coordination among organizational entities), processes, and procedures shall be maintained and used to manage protection of information systems and assets. Backups of information shall be conducted, maintained, and tested

Name: Protect Process and Procedures - Physical Operating Environment
Description: Security policies (that address purpose, scope, roles, responsibilities, management commitment, and coordination among organizational entities), processes, and procedures shall be maintained and used to manage protection of information systems and assets. Policy and regulations regarding the physical operating environment for organizational assets shall be met

Name: Protect Process and Procedures - Data Destruction
Description: Security policies (that address purpose, scope, roles, responsibilities, management commitment, and coordination among organizational entities), processes, and procedures shall be maintained and used to manage protection of information systems and assets. Data shall be destroyed according to policy

Name: Protect Process and Procedures - Process Continually Improved
Description: Security policies (that address purpose, scope, roles, responsibilities, management commitment, and coordination among organizational entities), processes, and procedures shall be maintained and used to manage protection of information systems and assets. Protection processes shall be improved

Name: Protect Process and Procedures - Sharing Effectiveness
Description: Security policies (that address purpose, scope, roles, responsibilities, management commitment, and coordination among organizational entities), processes, and procedures shall be maintained and used to manage protection of information systems and assets. Effectiveness of protection technologies shall be shared

Name: Protect Process and Procedures - Response and Recovery Plans
Description: Security policies (that address purpose, scope, roles, responsibilities, management commitment, and coordination among organizational entities), processes, and procedures shall be maintained and used to manage protection of information systems and assets. Response plans (Incident Response and Business Continuity) and recovery plans (Incident Recovery and Disaster Recovery) shall be in place and managed

Name: Protect Process and Procedures - Response and Recovery Plan Testing
Description: Security policies (that address purpose, scope, roles, responsibilities, management commitment, and coordination among organizational entities), processes, and procedures shall be maintained and used to manage protection of information systems and assets. Response and recovery plans shall be tested

Name: Protect Process and Procedures - Cybersecurity Included in HR
Description: Security policies (that address purpose, scope, roles, responsibilities, management commitment, and coordination among organizational entities), processes, and procedures shall be maintained and used to manage protection of information systems and assets. Cybersecurity shall be included in human resources practices (e.g., deprovisioning, personnel screening)

Name: Protect Process and Procedures - Vulnerability Management Plan
Description: Security policies (that address purpose, scope, roles, responsibilities, management commitment, and coordination among organizational entities), processes, and procedures shall be maintained and used to manage protection of information systems and assets. A vulnerability management plan shall be developed and implemented

Name: Protect Maintenance - Perform and Log Maintenance in Timely Manner
Description: Maintenance and repairs of industrial control and information system components shall be performed consistent with policies and procedures. Maintenance and repair of organizational assets shall be performed and logged, with approved and controlled tools

Name: Protect Maintenance - Remote Maintenance Approvals
Description: Maintenance and repairs of industrial control and information system components shall be performed consistent with policies and procedures. Remote maintenance of organizational assets shall be approved, logged, and performed in a manner that prevents unauthorized access

Name: Protect Technology - Audit Logging
Description: Technical security solutions shall be managed to ensure the security and resilience of systems and assets, consistent with related policies, procedures, and agreements. Audit/log records shall be determined, documented, implemented, and reviewed in accordance with policy

Name: Protect Technology - Removable Media
Description: Technical security solutions shall be managed to ensure the security and resilience of systems and assets, consistent with related policies, procedures, and agreements. Removable media shall be protected and its use restricted according to policy

Name: Protect Technology - Principle of Least Functionality
Description: Technical security solutions shall be managed to ensure the security and resilience of systems and assets, consistent with related policies, procedures, and agreements. The principle of least functionality shall be incorporated by configuring systems to provide only essential capabilities

Name: Protect Technology - Communication and Control Networks
Description: Technical security solutions shall be managed to ensure the security and resilience of systems and assets, consistent with related policies, procedures, and agreements. Communications and control networks shall be protected

Name: Protect Technology - Resilience Mechanisms
Description: Technical security solutions shall be managed to ensure the security and resilience of systems and assets, consistent with related policies, procedures, and agreements. Mechanisms (e.g., failsafe, load balancing, hot swap) shall be implemented to achieve resilience requirements in normal and adverse situations

Name: Recover Communications - Public Relations
Description: Restoration activities shall be coordinated with internal and external parties, such as coordinating centers, Internet Service Providers, owners of attacking systems, victims, other CSIRTs, and vendors. Public relations shall be managed

Name: Recover Communications - Reputation
Description: Restoration activities shall be coordinated with internal and external parties, such as coordinating centers, Internet Service Providers, owners of attacking systems, victims, other CSIRTs, and vendors. Reputation shall be repaired after an incident

Name: Recover Communications - Recovery Activities Communicated
Description: Restoration activities shall be coordinated with internal and external parties, such as coordinating centers, Internet Service Providers, owners of attacking systems, victims, other CSIRTs, and vendors. Recovery activities shall be communicated to internal stakeholders and executive and management teams

Name: Recover Improvements - Lessons Learned
Description: Recovery planning and processes shall be improved by incorporating lessons learned into future activities. Recovery plans incorporate lessons learned

Name: Recover Improvements - Strategies Updated
Description: Recovery planning and processes shall be improved by incorporating lessons learned into future activities. Recovery strategies shall be updated

Name: Recover Planning - Plan Execution
Description: Recovery processes and procedures shall be executed and maintained to ensure restoration of systems or assets affected by cybersecurity incidents. Recovery plan shall be executed during or after a cybersecurity incident

Name: Respond Analysis - Investigate Incidents
Description: Analysis shall be conducted to ensure effective response and support recovery activities. Notifications from detection systems shall be investigated

Name: Respond Analysis - Impact Analysis
Description: Analysis shall be conducted to ensure effective response and support recovery activities. The impact of the incident shall be understood

Name: Respond Analysis - Perform Forensics
Description: Analysis shall be conducted to ensure effective response and support recovery activities. Forensics shall be performed

Name: Respond Analysis - Categorize Incidents
Description: Analysis shall be conducted to ensure effective response and support recovery activities. Incidents shall be categorized consistent with response plans

Name: Respond Analysis - Vulnerability Response
Description: Analysis shall be conducted to ensure effective response and support recovery activities. Processes shall be established to receive, analyze and respond to vulnerabilities disclosed to the organization from internal and external sources (e.g. internal testing, security bulletins, or security researchers)

Name: Respond Communications - Roles and Responsibilities
Description: Response activities shall be coordinated with internal and external stakeholders (e.g. external support from law enforcement agencies). Personnel shall know their roles and order of operations when a response is needed

Name: Respond Communications - Event Reporting Criteria
Description: Response activities shall be coordinated with internal and external stakeholders (e.g. external support from law enforcement agencies). Incidents shall be reported consistent with established criteria

Name: Respond Communications - Sharing Consistent with Plans
Description: Response activities shall be coordinated with internal and external stakeholders (e.g. external support from law enforcement agencies). Information shall be shared consistent with response plans

Name: Respond Communications - Stakeholder Coordination
Description: Response activities shall be coordinated with internal and external stakeholders (e.g. external support from law enforcement agencies). Coordination with stakeholders shall be consistent with response plans

Name: Respond Communications - Voluntary Information Sharing
Description: Response activities shall be coordinated with internal and external stakeholders (e.g. external support from law enforcement agencies). Voluntary information sharing shall be with external stakeholders to achieve broader cybersecurity situational awareness

Name: Respond Improvements - Lessons Learned
Description: Organizational response activities shall be improved by incorporating lessons learned from current and previous detection/response activities. Response plans incorporate lessons learned

Name: Respond Improvements - Strategies Updated
Description: Organizational response activities shall be improved by incorporating lessons learned from current and previous detection/response activities. Response strategies shall be updated

Name: Respond Mitigation - Contain Incidents
Description: Activities shall be performed to prevent expansion of an event, mitigate its effects, and resolve the incident. Incidents shall be contained

Name: Respond Mitigation - Mitigate Incidents
Description: Activities shall be performed to prevent expansion of an event, mitigate its effects, and resolve the incident. Incidents shall be mitigated

Name: Respond Mitigation - New Vulnerabilities are Mitigated
Description: Activities shall be performed to prevent expansion of an event, mitigate its effects, and resolve the incident. Newly identified vulnerabilities shall be mitigated or documented as accepted risks

Name: Respond Planning - Execution of Plan
Description: Response processes and procedures shall be executed and maintained, to ensure timely response to detected cybersecurity events. Response plan shall be executed during or after an incident
